questions.question: I ………………………….. to the manager about my holiday in the morning.
questions.description: The simple past is used to say that something happened at some point in the past.

questions.question: We ……………………………. to the theatre last night.
He ……………………………. the pictures on the wall.
The ship has ……………………………….
questions.description: People drown ships and boats sink.

questions.question: When I went there I found that he ……………………………..
He ……………………………… to me since our last meeting.
We ……………………………. tennis every day.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about facts.

questions.question: Neither of the messengers ……………………………… returned.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: The quality of these apples ……………………………… not good.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun quality hence, a singular verb should be used.

questions.question: Death ……………………………… his icy hand on all.
He ……………………………… there for the last two hours.
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, use the present perfect or present perfect continuous.
